Reviews.Title: “V good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find, 5 min drive from airport, they have shuttle service. Complementary breakfast is nice, small, but good produce. The rooms are big, bed V comfy. For an airport hotel this is one of the best. Parking is just out front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica W
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here and the Hyatt Downtown. This is by far better. The rooms are bigger, the staff was so nice, parking is free and the free breakfast was good. My pick every time Im in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Price!”
Reviews.Author: RK2004
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the price of Hyatt Place! For what you get it's a steal! I try and stay at a Hyatt Place whenever possible. Always clean and great service, my only complaint is the price of snacks/food from the Gallery which are way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suemidd
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we weren't sure about it since it seemed cheap and was near the airport, but it turned out to be one of the best places we've ever stayed. I now look for Hyatt Places everywhere we go because it was so nice for the price. Wonderfully modern rooms, big tvs, comfy bed, quiet. The continental breakfast was pretty good - but I've had better (and worse!). Overall we loved our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: sarahgroves
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with Hyatt Place Indianapolis Airport. Room was awesome, spacious and wall mounted flat screen tv that you could see from the bed or the sofa. The room was very clean. Front desk was super!!!! Our flight was so early, we missed the contiential breakfast. Shuttle service was prompt. We will be staying here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New clean nice but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: mstaske
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel is very clean and the rooms are nicly appointed. Shuttle to airport and continential breakfast. But it is not the cheapest hotel. All the airport hotels around indy seem to be charging for more than your stay parking. However we did get these guys to let our car stay here for a week eventhough we only stayed one night. Try the greek island restaurant near downtown 5 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Huasobruto
Reviews.Content: We've never had a bad experience at any Hyatt Place, and we will continue to stay at these properties. There are five of us, so the large rooms are wonderful, and this property was like others: clean and with a courteous staff. The only downside was that the pool is outside and closed for the winter. The price was very low...and only about 10 minutes from downtown Indy...and only about two miles from the Tamale Place...where everyone MUST eat when in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Showers & Bad Wifi”
Reviews.Author: dmp717200
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times this month. And have encountered the following each time. Shower temperature fluctuates drastically.. Sink water takes 10 minutes to get warm enough to shave. The wifi keeps cutting out, no matter which room you're in. And one of the elevators has been out all month, increasing wait times. Other than that, the beds are comfy, there is a free breakfast (although the only free protein would be milk), and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best....”
Reviews.Author: FullThrottle64
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Hyatt Places several times before, and been quite pleased. This time, however, there were a few things that just didn't hold up as well. 1) The breakfast service was terrible. It shouldn't take 25 minutes to get a basic omelette from a limited menu. Their computer-order system at this property means that you have to pre-pay for the food without ever seeing an individual - you can't even tell if the cook is working. We had to ask someone at the desk twice before we got our food, and this delay ended up causing us to be late for our customer appointment. By itself, this is enough to keep me from ever staying here again. Bottom line - either go back to a buffet or to real servers who can tell you if they can't deliver in a reasonable time, so you can just move on to your business day in a timely manner. 2) I understand the desire to use shampoo dispensers instead of individual bottles - it's a cost-cutting measure that really doesn't cause a problem for most customers. However, "bath gel" isn't soap. Finding out that there is no bar soap in the bathroom at 6:30 AM is NOT pleasant, and a little sign stating it's available at the front desk is worthless. Who is really going to get dressed to go down to the front desk so that they can come back upstairs to get undressed and take a shower? The sign saying it's a "green" practice is just insulting - go ahead and at least admit it's a cost-cutting measure and be honest about it - or better yet, just put the soap back into the bathrooms. 3) Toilet paper in the rooms - unusable. About 2" narrower than a standard roll, and so thin as to be worthless for its intended use. 'Nuff said. 4) Why would a hotel spend so much money on large-screen TVs in the rooms, then have them set up with the format incorrect so that everything is either squished or fuzzy? That's just a lack of attention to detail, and should have been handled when they were installed. It doesn't cost any more to get this sort of thing right.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: RichardMadow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly as it should be - clean, friendly, fairly spacious with simply decorated rooms. Don't expect the Hyatt Regency and you may be quite pleased. However - the heating system was incredibly loud and the fan could not be kept on constantly, causing it to loudly restart throughout the night. It was seriously loud - every fifteen minutes or so it sounded like the Indy 500 itself was coming to the room! It would not have been so bad if the noise were steady but the on and off was incredibly annoying. Too bad - it is actually a cool little hotel and the rooms were quite nice, but in the end, at an airport hotel it's all about getting a good night's sleep and that was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Gives a good name to airport hotels!”
Reviews.Author: California-SLC
Reviews.Content: I usually try to avoid airport hotels, but this time circumstances forced me into it. We were arriving late into IND and I wasn't familiar enough with the area to want to drive around late at night. So my goal was to find someplace decent close to the airport and with on-site food for hungry travelers. When we landed at the airport and found all of the food places already locked up and rain pouring down outside, I was especially glad I'd thought of that part. We found the hotel fairly easily (although warning to travelers leaving IND--there's MAJOR construction in that area with lane closures all over the place). The people at the front desk were welcoming and helpful. When we asked about food, they suggested that we place our order and they would prepare it while we put our bags in our room. This worked well--the food was hot and surprisingly good when we came back downstairs, and the small on-site bar was a welcome surprise. The best part of the hotel, however, was the comfortable and spacious room we stayed in. The door opened up to a "living area" part with a couch, small bar area with a coffee maker and refrigerator, and an ample desk. Beyond this was a sizeable area with the beds, which were extremely comfortable. A large TV was centered so that it could be viewed from either area. The entire room was modern-looking and very clean. In short, if this is what airport hotels are like, I may have to rethink my position on avoiding them!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with park and fly”
Reviews.Author: loverofcats22
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with friendly staff. Room was lovely and comfortable. Loved the soap,shampoo dispensor in shower. Room had refrig and lovely sitting area with large flat screened tv. Left early for airport using park and fly. All went very smooth and convenient to airport. Even provided breakfast to go which we enjoyed once we checked in at airport. Will plan to use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dorjean
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious, however closet space is very small. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: llester31
Reviews.Content: We did the park, sleep and fly with this hotel. The hotel is very close to the airport. The room was clean and updated. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. We were taken to the airport on time. When we returned from our trip we called the hotel from baggage claim and they were waiting on us at the pick up area. This was wonderful as our flight did not get in until 11:45 p.m. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: 4travellite
Reviews.Content: We were there for the MotoGP at the Indy speedway. Had 2 rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful. Location is isolated you will need a car to get around. The back of the property sits near a power substation. The better views- the front side. Rooms clean and quiet. Our first night the hotel was booked, never heard anyone else. Free breakfast: carbs- o- plenty short on protein. We ordered a plate of eggs and bacon and split it 4 ways about 7$. Boys loved the pool and free Wi-Fi. With a car, downtown is about 15 minute drive, Keystone Mall about 30 minutes away. Speedway is about 10 minutes away-may be longer on a race day. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale room and amenities”
Reviews.Author: shnewb
Reviews.Content: The room is very spacious. It has a couch area, bar area with sink and refrigerator and desk area with Wi-Fi. The bathroom amenities included shampoo, conditioner and soap dispenser which were very high quality. There is also toothpaste and a nice hair dryer. The tv is a flat screen that swivels. The closet is a bit small but ok if you are staying around 2-4 days. There is ample space to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Indianapolis Airport for several nights. This is probably my 4th stay at this property and I keep coming back due to the clean/spacious rooms, convenient location (not at the airport, but really not very far - and close to where I work), and very good rates. Plus, it helps me get Hyatt points. The rooms have a nice LCD TV, refrigerator, and sectional couch. Also, no problems with the Internet at this property. All in all, a good value and I would recommend it for any business traveler. Note, there is very little in the immediate area so make sure you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Isolated Location”
Reviews.Author: awaxy
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Place had a wonderfully friendly staff. The rooms were average for this chain, comfortable enough, had a mini fridge, maybe a bit larger room than the norm. The "free" breakfast was a notch below what I've had at many Hampton Inns. Biggest problem is the location. Without a car you are pretty much stuck. There is a gas station/minimart across the street and a Denny's about a quarter or third of a mile away. The TV choices are limited - no Discovery or Food Network which are my "go to" channels. If you are going to Indy, try to stay downtown - LOTS more going on. I couldn't this trip due to a gamers convention.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room and service.”
Reviews.Author: sarahgroves
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt Place and did their Park and Fly package. The room was fresh and clean, nice set up with king bed and couch with nice, big TV mounted on the wall. The bed and bed linen was super comfy!!!! The airport shuttle left promptly at our scheduled time. The driver was fantastic and got us there safely dispite the ice storm that was going on!!! We had a prompt pick up upon our arrival back in Indy!!! Very convient and would highly recommend staying at this gem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for one night and was satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: dlharris9798
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt. The gym was outstanding for a hotel of this size. The provided breakfast was very satisfying. The pool was warm but a little small. My room did not have a microwave oven, which I needed late at night to warm some food. There is a microwave oven on the first floor in the dining area that guests are allowed to use.

Reviews.Title: “Always a solid stay!”
Reviews.Author: onlyalivebriefly
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often for busines trips. I'm never disappointed in the quality of the room, service, or food. The staff is friendly (and funny). The Hotel itself has a neat and clean appearance. I'd recommend this to any business traveler. Not so much if you're traveling for fun (as the hotel itself isn't located close to many attractions), but perfect if you want a peaceful rest before heading to get some work done the next day then this is your place! Even with the airport being so close, I had no problems getting to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “No Water”
Reviews.Author: jtf512
Reviews.Content: Not only did the hotel not have water, but the desk clerk told me the city had warned this could happen and guests weren't alerted to the problem. I wasn;t offered a refund, only some community water in the lobby to brush my teeth.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: AirlineGuyNYC
Reviews.Content: Superb decor, extremely comfortable beds and room. Nice little outdoor pool with lounge chairs if you want to catch a few rays and relax. Only two negatives-- one is there is nothing within walking distance of hotel if you want to eat. The hotel does offer sandwiches and salads and a limited menu, but if you prefer to dine out then you are out of luck unless you have a car with you. The other negative is they no longer have individual soap or toiletries in the bathroom, but rather "dispensers" in the shower for shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner. Over all, Hyatt Place does it right, and I would most definitely recommend this hotel. Front desk staff was very courteous, professional, and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankll1a
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hyatt Place for a business trip... Very good 3 star... The hotel has a shuttle, but elected to rent a car. With some of the construction, it is a little difficult to find the hotel - about 2.5 miles (most hotels are that far away) - and if you miss the turn off of the highway - it is a much longer journey. So suggest GPS or print the directions... Complimentary parking... The hotel staff is excellent - great greeting, described the hotel features, and provided directions when requested. The rooms are very nice - very large, large King bed, 42" flat screen, separate sitting area (large couch), and desk with extra power, internet ports, small refrig. Free Wifi... Bed was very comfortable. Shower & bath were OK. Everything very clean & like new. Free breakfast is continental, but can also purchase hot breakfast - and there is a fairly good selection, with good quality, a little expensive, but reasonable... There is a small bar downstairs - and they do serve food (limited selection) until very late. Overall, very good business hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kaimannaa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt Indy Airport late at night, on our way to another Route 66 trip. Check-in was efficient and friendly, and our room was very nice! Spacious, clean modern decor (clean room, too), with plenty of space to relax, work, or even whip up a sandwich. The hotel was quiet even though, we learned when my husband went down to the front desk for something, there was a large collection of very happy flight attendants in town for a convention. Ahem. LOL The bed was comfortable, the room perfectly dark at night. The hotel provides shampoo, conditioner, and soap in the shower for you via dispenser. Plenty of towels as well. In the morning, I was able to get hot water from the very nice eating area for my tea, and there seems to be plenty of variety as well. The gal making breakfast seemed to be overwhelmed, though—tons of people this Saturday morning!—so we went elsewhere for that. The staff were all professional, kind and making jokes with guests, a nice change from other places! We were very impressed with this Hyatt, and would absolutely stay again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: YAMA0611
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for early flight. Since we had to leave hotel 5 in the morning, we couldn't make it to the free breakfast, but they nicely offered us some cereal the night before. The room was very modern, and you'll love it for the price! Everything is clean, new and trendy. The location is near the airport, so it is very convenient for traveling (they have free shuttle bus service). As for the restaurants, they recommended us a nice steakhouse nearby, and they even dropped and picked us up. It's a nice restaurant, but very pricey. I would definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WCubed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. We were in Indy to visit the Indy 500 Museum and race practice. Positives: 1) Considering the construction in and around Indianapolis, we found the hotel easily. 2) From the lobby to the rooms, the hotel was elegant, considering the cost, and very clean. 3) The staff was very helpful and friendly. 4) The room was very large, and set up like a suite. It had a kitchenette with fridge and sink, and a living room area with a hugh L shaped sofa. The flat screen HD TV was also huge, and we enjoyed it for watching sports events when we returned to the room. 5) The continental breakfast was simple but sufficient, and they supply real dishes and silverware. Breakfast to order is available 24 hours a day at an additional charge. 6) Our room was very quiet. 7) The bathroom sink was separate from the toilet and shower. This is good, but the toilet and shower area was very small. Negatives (Only slight ones): 1) The bed was a little too soft for my taste. I have a bad back and firmer is better. 2) There are not many restaurants in the immediate area. In short, we would certainly stay here on our next visit to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for IMS Weekends”
Reviews.Author: Crushr99
Reviews.Content: Three easy routes to Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Great staff. Outstanding rooms. Great value. Free Parking. Why stay downtown?

Reviews.Title: “Great great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beezlebubba
Reviews.Content: I love this place! I stayed here before an early morning flight. When I got to the airport, I found out that my flight had been canceled, and all flights out that day were also canceled [this was during one of the 3 or so East Coast Snowpocalypses this winter]. I called the hotel when I found out I was going no where fast, and they saved my room for me and sent the shuttle driver back for me immediately. Sadly, I had the very same luck with flights the next day and called the hotel back to re-book. They had my room again, and gratefully put me back up for the additional night. In addition to the great service, they have great service and amenities. Free parking [you can even drop your car off here and avoid parking fees during your travel], free www, free breakfast [somewhat limited--fruit/yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, toast/bagels--but more than enough for me], huge TV, great sitting space, very nice bed. And the list goes on! The only downside is location. There's not a lot around in the immediate area, and it's not real convenient to the airport, but they have a shuttle that will take you to the airport or other locations nearby. The shuttle driver was very helpful--she drove me back and forth a bunch of times and was very friendly about it every time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Hart1092
Reviews.Content: I stay at several hyatt place hotels and I must say this one is the worst because of thier front desk employees. They seem to go out of thier way to say no to the customer. I love all the other hyat place hotels but this one I can not recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the sleek modern room”
Reviews.Author: NaMacD2
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Hyatt Place Airport during a business trip. I wish there were a hotel like this everywhere I stay! Staff were friendly and professional, but it was the layout and decor of the room that really pleased me. My standard king room was not super-large, but the layout made it seem spacious. Instead of a giant work desk and stodgy bulky chest of drawers, you are offered a very nice new modular couch, a reasonable desk, and a wet bar with a good coffee maker and fridge. BIG flat screen TV, comfy bed with nice linens. Smallish bath, but guess what, in addition to nice toiletries, they provide toothpaste! Such a small thing, but very nice. I even liked the artwork.

Reviews.Title: “Best night sleep of whole vacation”
Reviews.Author: cstaskie
Reviews.Content: On our way home from WDW we stayed here. Had a great night sleep in very comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like luxury inside for 1/4 of the price...area not so great”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithbabies
Reviews.Content: Other than the area not being great...can't really walk to any restaurants and closest grocery store/main services a few miles away & a little questionable...the hotel was wonderful. This is the 2nd Hyatt Place that we have stayed at and both have been perfect. Great, attractive interior and very helpful staff. We reserved and received 2 adjoining hotel rooms and this worked perfectly for our stay (one family in each room). Having starbucks coffee, wine, and mixed drinks in the lobby was awesome and a perk you don't see in this range of room price.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly is the best bargain around!”
Reviews.Author: mowery72
Reviews.Content: My family of four travelled from Indy to Disney World. We actually live 2 hours from Indy. Since we would be parking our car for a total of 10 days, even with the economy parking rates, we would be paying around $80. I paid a few bucks more and stayed here the night before our flight. GREAT decision. The staff here is amazing, both leaving and upon our return, the airport shuttle service was unbeatable. The room was clean, well-appointed and everything worked well. The continental breakfast was perfect for a quick bite before we got on our plane. I HIGHLY recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of a long drive, this was a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RuHuNJ
Reviews.Content: Just driving Indianapolis, and was so happy we stayed here. Welcoming recpetion, clean and comfortable room, excellent breakfast. All in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KHMichigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and made sure we got the early check in that we requested. The hotel rooms are sensational. The rooms have a home like feel to them, with a seating area with a large sectional couch, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker, and separate bedroom section with comfy beds and linens. The bathroom was very small but functional. There are ice machines on every floor, no vending machines and a outside pool. We heard no planes when we stayed here, so we did not hear any airnoise. There was a large guest member list of flight attendants and pilots when checking in and out. There are two computers availabe for guest and a adequate sized fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shaffers10
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place at Indy Airport is hands down excellent. Clean, big rooms for parents with 2 kids. Good location, easy to get to from interstate. My family stays here yearly for the Brickyard race. Only about a 15 minute drive to the track. Have stayed 3 times there now and never had a problem. The food at the "bar" and the "made to order" menu are a bit pricey, but it's just as easy to order a pizza for delivery. Pool is big enough to accomadate multiple guests at once. I do, and will continue to use Hyatt Place, Indy Airport for all my trips to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to start our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: indoc1971
Reviews.Content: We had a very early flight out of Indy so we decided to start our vacation early with an overnite stay near the airport. We chose Hyatt Place due to its location, park/fly option, and room setup with allowed for some division between our king bed, the sleeper sofa for our son, and the pack-in-play for the baby. The lobby was well maintained, check in was efficient, and the room was very clean. Hotel staff were very pleasant even though they seemed to serve many capacities - one of our check-in people also covered the mini cafe/bar while another employee did check-in and brought us our requested pack-in-play (only to find that someone had already set one up in our room). The cafe menu had more food choices that I would expect and the food was very good (my son said the shrimp cocktail was among the best he's ever had!). My mixed drink was well made. Prices were acceptable. We were able to leave our car for up to 14d with our overnite room stay - when you consider parking rates at the airport, this probably meant our room cost something under $25-30! We would definitely stay here again if the chance came up (and we live <30min away!)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great business trip or semi-leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinjen
Reviews.Content: Came here for a friend's wedding and en-route to another destination. i would have preferred to stay in downtown or even at the Hyatt Place at Keystone, but logistically, this worked better for us. Plus, there was a huge conference downtown and all the hotels were booked up (including this Hyatt Place). Check was fine. The check in person was proactive and nice enough to give us various options on different floors. Room is big and comfortable, with a wet bar area (with sink & fridge), comfortable desk, free wifi, and sofa. Everything was clean albeit basic - use your own soap & shampoo. And it had an amazing huge, flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable. Not as comfortable as the Westin or Starwood beds, nor even Homewood Suites by Hilton, but I had a good night's sleep. And I'm pretty picky on beds. The gym was nice for a hotel gym, especially a non-resort-lower-level-hotel gym. Had 2 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines, 1 bike and weight machines in a pretty big room and all the cardio machines had TV's on it. Ok, the cons - The location is pretty drab. You're right next to the freeway. (But the noise never bothered me.) I went for a run in the morning and was running down highways and by factories. But what can you expect. It's an airport hotel. I didn't use the pool, but it's pretty small and noticed it didn't have hot tub. You can pretty much only splash around and lay out by it, not do laps. But again, it's by the highway, not exactly a 'lay out' and sun yourself area. My only gripe was breakfast. They ran out of oatmeal really early. Like 9 am. And it's supposed to go to 9:30 am. Plus, the food was mediocre. Cheap white bread, bagels & english muffins. Coffee was chauky - Have had better at McDonald's and Homewood suites. And the fruit they have has some kind of sugar solution so it tastes fake. Overall, this is the second time I've stayed at Hyatt Place. I'm a huge fan. Great price, good amenities, breakfast is included and nice room. Would stay in a heartbeat again. And it really has a nicer atmosphere. Very open floor plan, in lobby & in room, so it always feels airy and relaxing and bright. I've also have converted my husband to the joys of Hyatt Place. We usually stay at Holiday Inn Expresses when we just want to 'stay at a place' when we're not looking for a leisurely, luxurious vacation, but rather a place to full a specific purpose we're at the location (marathon, event, wedding, etc.). This has definitely usurped the HIE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a big flat screen TV”
Reviews.Author: mpaulet
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two nights for a business seminar and the staff was friendly, efficient and accomodating to my requests. The room was immaculate, large and comfortable. Even though I did not watch much TV, I enjoyed the fact that the huge flat screen had numerous inputs for various media like my laptop. The price is very reasonable for the high quality provided. The bars and activity are a short trip up the interstate to down town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JEM07032002
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights - October 30 & 31. We were in Indy to attend the ISSMA State Marching Band Finals at Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel was easy to find and is beautiful. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and clean. Beds were very soft and comfortable. The drive to LOS was just a couple of minutes - easy to get back and forth. Breakfast was OK - typical hotel breakfast. If I could get the same price again ($62/night - 30% off), I'd stay again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms. The Rest is OK.”
Reviews.Author: stevepd96
Reviews.Content: Like other renovated Hyatts, the lobby is nice and rooms are spacious. I love the large LDC TV and living room. Fridge was a plus (but no microwave?). Bed is comfortable. The lobby seemed to smell a bit. The pool was large, but nothing special. Overall impressed with the rooms, but I was expecting a nicer hotel/location considering all the great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a sweater”
Reviews.Author: geraldz
Reviews.Content: This hotel recently installed new digital thermostats on the HVAC units. The highest you can set it is 75 degrees. So if the unit thinks the room is warm enough, you had better agree. You have no way to make it warmer. Most ridiculous thing I've ever seen. I can't tell you how ofter I've shivered at this hotel during the winter months. Bring your sweaters, ladies!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tyra
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed overnight in this hotel because we had to catch an early flight at the Indy Airport. They have a special stay, park & fly deal that was very appealing to us. Upon arrival, I was greeted by two smiling gals at the front desk. They had our reservation & keys ready for our arrival. The business model for this chain should take over the entire midrange of extended stay business hotels!!! I was blown away by the thoughtful details that this hotel employs. They have 24 hour snack kiosks in the lobby where you can order food, snacks, etc.... They have huge 42 inch plasma tv's in the hotel rooms. They have a huge couch in the room with a pull out, very comfortable bed. Large comfortable beds. The shuttle in the morning was very organized and timely. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends/family and will definitely stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff, super location”
Reviews.Author: baywatchtoo
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight the next morning and drove in from Illinois the evening prior. The hotel staff was very helpful and accomodating. Kara, the Assistant General Manager gave us her business card that also included the hotel phone number and gave us instructions for our return shuttle from the airport. Since we were leaving our car parked at the hotel during our trip, Kara was very helpful with parking as well as informing us of the morning shuttle and continental breakfast. The hotel was clean and neat, our room was very nice, the beds comfy, or as my daughter says, "fluffy beds" and the room was equipped with a large flat screen tv and ports for a laptop into the tv. The next morning the breakfast buffet was ready before 6am. Selena made sure the fruit, bagels, cereal, coffee and juice was ready for early morning travelers, which we really appreciated. Hyatt Place was a great place to stay, had a super shuttle to and from the airport with a wonderful continental breakfast in clean and neat surroundings. We will definitely stay at Hyatt Place again. One note, we made our reservation through buyreservations.com and got an overnight stay and 2 weeks of parking and shuttle for $89. GREAT PRICE for a GREAT HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms, but service needs work”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: After a super-friendly check-in (I wish I had the clerk's name, since she was the only good one we encountered) we were quite pleased with the room. The design is inspired and we really liked the separate sitting area with the sectional couch, as well as the nice little work desk. The mini-fridge and sink area were also a big plus (although our fridge didn't cool sodas much beyond room temperature even overnight). The downside here was the "Gallery Host" concept in which the front desk clerks are also responsible for getting drinks and preparing snacks and hot food 24/7. In theory this is great -- we were delighted that we'd be able to get meals and snacks in the evening, right at the hotel. But the front desk people seemed really to dislike this part of their job and, in our stay, treated it as a nuisance and a bother. Hyatt Place has a great free continental breakfast set out buffet-style (as well as hot items for purchase). But, again, its success is dependent on staff. On our two mornings there the front desk clerk was deep in conversation with the shuttle driver before, during, and after breakfast, not refilling items in the breakfast area, clearing plates, or cleaning up spilled food from previous guests. Another morning a second clerk was shouting across the lobby to her colleague about some sort of custody or childcare problem. On check-out, a woman I assume was the manager (she wasn't wearing the sweater-set uniform of the other clerks) gave us a really hard time about a food item on the bill that we asked to have removed (it wasn't ours). Considering the many other items on the bill, most more expensive, that we weren't disputing, I was surprised at her response: she insisted mistakes were "impossible" because of their automated system. Our overall bill was several hundred dollars, so why she wanted to go five rounds about a $4 charge was beyond me. Again, we really liked the rooms and the breakfast, as well as the WiFi and the fitness room, but this was a pretty lame staff all around, with the exception of our young check-in clerk and a friendly airport shuttle driver. I'm not sure if we would stay here again or not, but I hope the management can get up to speed and get everyone on-board with the Hyatt Place "concept," which is indeed super and creative.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: anngold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in December 2008 for one night each time. The only glitch for me was the first night I waited half an hour in the cold for the shuttle at the airport. On my second visit I was picked up by the shuttle very quickly. The room was very clean and spacious. I am a light sleeper but was able to sleep soundly as there was very little outside noise that was audible. The breakfast was good with a nice variety of options. The staff even drove me to a local restaurant and came back and picked me up when I was finished. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ATVRider
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the price. Loved the 42" hi-def tv in the room. As always, the Hyatt bed was very comfortable. Would liked to have had a few more options at the breakfast, but everything else was very nice and we were very happy with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, great stay”
Reviews.Author: OhioArtsygirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose this hotel based on proximity to the Indianapolis Airport and an early flight (6:30AM). We booked the Park, Stay and Fly deal because we did not want to deal with the hassle of long-term parking. Unfortunately, this was such a short stay in such a cute hotel! In my opinion, the decor in the room is along the lines of an upscale boutique hotel. We were sad that we weren't saying here longer! The sectional sofa and ottoman were a nice feature in the room and the beds were very comfortable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We were not able to grab full breakfast since we had to leave so early, but by the looks of the cafe area, there was quite a selection. One thing with the parking is that our car was not in a separate lot, so we're hoping that security is not an issue upon our return. Also, the bathroom was a little on the smaller side, and you could tell that it was not really remodeled with the other features in the bedroom, although it was very clean and well-appointed. There was a huge big-screen tv and workstation desk for all internet/business needs. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on there way to Indy, or those flying in/out of Indianapolis Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With Our Decision”
Reviews.Author: RosyOhio
Reviews.Content: After reading through all of the recent reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor, we decided to start our family vacation off by staying at the Hyatt Place to take advantage of the Park-Sleep-Fly program. Because we were driving from Englewood, Ohio - we wanted to avoid getting up at 0300 to catch our 0700 Airtran flight from the Airport. We were 100% satisfied with the lobby, customer service, Continental breakfast, and room. The room was super clean, comfortable and spacious. We also thought it was very quiet especially for being so close to the airport. We expected our car to be parked in the back lot while we were gone but it was not. The Hotel staff suggested we park where ever we wanted so we left it parked in the front lot underneath the security lights where we felt confident it would be properly looked after while we were gone for the next week. The hotel shuttle was prompt dropping us off (with only a 10 minute notice) and picking us back up the from the airport upon our return. He also invited us in for a hot cup of coffee and snack before we headed home since we arrived home in the early am when most places (McDonalds, etc.) were closed for the evening where we could buy coffee. Will stay with Hyatt Place again in future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Saved the Trip”
Reviews.Author: adurst08
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport (early flight), but now I will choose it any time we are in Indy. After our wedding reception late Friday we drove to Indianapolis, on our way WE HIT A DEER! We called our hotel to tell them what had happened and that our check in would be MUCH later. When we arrived at the hotel the concierge was waiting for us with our room keys and complementary beverages in hand. She gave us a quiet corner room on the top floor and saw to it that housekeeping did not do our floor until very late in the afternoon. Throughout our stay we were amazed at the staff and their willingness to go the extra mile to help. The room was large and spacious with drapes that closed all the way (no slivers of sunshine peeking in), a cozy corner sofa, large work desk and separate area with a sink and mini refridgerator. The overall stay was very pleasant and we were almost sad to leave for our flight after 2 days. Great place to stay. Also, even though it was an airport hotel we could not hear the planes.

Reviews.Title: “Yuckie Mildew!”
Reviews.Author: mommiecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed the weekend at the Hyatt for the Brickyard 400. The room was a little disappointing considering the cost of over $400 for two nights even with a AAA discount. The room looked clean until I walked into the bathroom and there was mildew all up in the clear faucet handle and mildew stains along the tub and tile under the faucet. You would think for an upscale hotel that the room would be impecable. The closet was so small you could barely hang 5 items and no dresser for storing smaller articles of clothes. So, we basically lived out of the suitcase. On the plus side, there was a 42" tv, a sectional sofa, internet access, a wet bar, and office desk with chair, and the bed was confortable with goose down pillows. They had a great free Continental Breakfast of cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, English muffins, milk, OJ. apple juice and coffee . All in all, I felt uncomfortable and wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usagary
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Hyatt Place and I was very pleased. We arrived there on our drive from NC to WI and had booked a single night at $89 on their website. The check-in was uneventful. Oddly we were given a "tour" of the hotel. The clerk asked another couple to come along for the tour also but they declined. The tour was essentially a 30-second "here's where this is, here's where that is." The room was wonderful. The suite was essentially a large room divided by a half wall, one side being the bedroom, the other side being the living area. The room included a high def TV with sofa and stool, fridge. The TV swiveled so you could watch from either the bed or sofa. We were very pleased. Check-out was uneventful except that the clerk didn't initially offer us a receipt. He quickly produced one when we asked. We were going to try the continental breakfast but needed to get on the road. The breakfast has your basics like fruit, cereal, coffee, juice and also a waffle iron. It was a nice touch. If we're ever in the Indy area again, this is probably where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JA78
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Left on an early flight, and had breakfast ready to go for us. Quick and friendly shuttle to airport. Note that if you bring cables, easy to hook up laptops and other media to the TV. Smallish pool.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to the other reviews other than to say that most are right on target. We stayed there the evening of pole day at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. For $103 (including taxes) we had a big room, couch, mini-fridge, HD TV, free wireless internet, continental breakfast. If I had to complain, there didn't seem to be many restaurants nearby, but the front desk had menus from a Chinese place that delivered to the room.

Reviews.Title: “As usual, Hyatt Place is great!”
Reviews.Author: artemis021
Reviews.Content: If you've never stayed in a Hyatt Place, you're in for a treat. The rooms really are fantastic, wtih a large sofa, comfortable bed, and a big flat-screen TV. When I check in, the front-desk attendant asked if I wanted a room on a high or low floor. After she gave me my key, she walked around the desk to shake my hand and told me let her know if I needed anything. I've never had that happen before. There was free apples and a computer with free internet. The rooms really are the best part about this place. The location was fantastic for the airport (with a free shuttle ride there) but not so good for carless people for eating. HP does offer some food for sale, as other reviewers have mentioned. When I was there, some other people got a shuttle ride to a nearby steakhouse. (Well, I think it was a steakhouse. They were recommending the steak at any rate.) I don't know if that is normal procedure, or it was because they weren't terribly busy. (All I was concerned about was that the shuttle went to the airport.)

Reviews.Title: “A life saver”
Reviews.Author: justtourists
Reviews.Content: The service was prompt and excellent. The room was not only spotlessly clean but also laid out in a way that makes sense, modern, spacious, and comfy, with a big screen TV. Actual ceramic cups, sealed, with the coffee maker. Downstairs is what they call the cafe, basically the other side of the check-in counter, where they offer food and drink 24 hours a day. The menu consists of soups, salads, sandwiches, and it's all made to order, to eat right there or take up to the room. We had tomato soup and turkey sandwich, it was fresh and delicious. I also saw cooked breakfast items on the menu. I like the convenience of having this type of food option, much less hassle than having to go to a proper restaurant, especially when arriving late at night. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, impressed”
Reviews.Author: KY-OH-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after attending a concert. The decor is very modern and the room and building were very clean. The hotel was quiet and conveniently located and the cost was much less than poorer quality hotels I've stayed in. The beds were comfortable and the room had a separate sitting area which provided more room than a typical hotel room. No smoking is allowed in the building even though the website offers smoking rooms. The tv also does not offer much channels unless you pay an additional fee. Those were the only negatives. An indoor pool would have been nice. For the cost, convenience, and quality of the hotel you can't beat this hotel. I would definately stay here again if I was in the area. The hotel was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: earz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a team event and the staff were incredible...went way over and above what would be expected in what appeared to be their geninue desire to help us. The rooms are spacious and were a GREAT value for the price. Hotel was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: baseball_dad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a business meeting and loved it. They picked me up at the airport in their shuttle which arrived promptly. Rooms are big and very stylish with cool flat panel TVs. Nice breakfast area - wished I could have stayed here a 2nd night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to wait out the weather .....”
Reviews.Author: silentbob007
Reviews.Content: When I fly out of Indianapolis, I'm usually only coming from an hour or two away. However, with early flights, I've found that it is sometimes just easier to say near the airport. In my most recent trip, I saw winter weather coming and decided to head down early. I decided to book this stay at the last minute. Rack rates were $89/night on the Hyatt website, but I booked it for a $37 bid on Priceline ($49 inclusive of taxes and fees). I know that you can't do park/fly on Priceline, but this seems to be an often won 2.5 star hotel in the Indy airport zone. I was dropped off at the hotel around noon and was greeted warmly and immediately allowed to check in. I was given a King room at the end of the hall on the fourth floor. The room had two living areas, one with the bed and another with a convertible couch, desk (with free wifi), sink, and small fridge. Other amenities included a coffee maker, coffee and tea, alarm clock, and a 42-inch HDTV. The TV had a connections port that allowed you to hook basically any kind of input easily into the TV if needed (composite, component, VGA, HDMI, etc). About the only complaint I had was with the bathroom, which was fairly tiny and had only one light, which made it kind of dark. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport, which is convenient. There is not really much around the hotel, though, so be aware that obtaining outside food might be hard. I walked across the street to a Marathon station for some snacks, and there is a Dennys a bit down the road, but that was too far for slushy weather without sidewalks. The hotel offers cafe-style food 24 hours a day, and I ended up ordering two sandwiches during my stay. You can grab to-go food from a display or you can order hot food via a touch-screen located in the food area. The sandwiches I ordered took about 5-10 minutes to prepare but were oven toasted and cost about $8, with soda costing another $2. A free continental breakfast is offered (along with paid hot fare), but I left before it started so I cannot comment on that. In the end, I was very happy with the room and the fact that I could get some hot food at the hotel without paying exorbitant room service fees. The staff were always eager to help, and there was a touch of style and class to the place. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Something to”
Reviews.Author: hohohaha
Reviews.Content: Read good review about this hotel, and choose based on recommendation. Overall enjoyed a short one-day stay although there are something to be improved. - Check-in: Had some problem with self check-in (designated room are not ready??) - Room: Was relatively OK but have some problem. Broken mug and unfinished vanity area. Also, bathroom was too dark. Have to open the door. - Wireless Internet: Had some problem when log-in first, but finally able to log in. However, the overall speed was really slow.. - Breakfast: Was really nice breakfast. Hope it opens a bit late than 9:30AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay While in Indy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lary1047
Reviews.Content: GREAT PLACE to stay !!! Will stay here next time while in INDY!! We were very happily surprised and has high ratings with us. The stay was great and the TV was amazing and NO Air Traffic sound!!!

Reviews.Title: “OH no the secret is out”
Reviews.Author: griffjr
Reviews.Content: oh no now the secret is out. htatt place. revolutionizing hotel travel for business and pleasure Unfortunately only got to stay for 7 hours the other night but what a 7 hours it was. Everything was so fantastic and brand new and the staff was extremely nice and friendly. EVER HEARD OF A HOTEL THAT ACTUALLY SMELLED GOOD? IM NOT SURE WHAT IT WAS BUT STEPPING ON AND OFF THE ELEVATOR WAS LIKE STEPPING INTO A FLOWER GARDER. ROOMS ARE HUGE AND YOU CAN ORDER ANYTHING ON TV. OH DID I MENTION ITS A 42 PLASMA WITH ALL HD CHANNELS. I ordered one night of the MLB package while I was there for only $6.95. i will try to stay no where else but the hyall place from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Living in Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: SimplyyRedd
Reviews.Content: The moment we drove up to the hotel, we knew we were in for a great stay. We were greeted with a smile the moment we entered the lobby. The hotel staff were very helpful in assisting us with the quick check-in by using the hotel computer for guests (1st time doing that). We were really impressed with the modern, colorful decor. I had seen these same pictures on-line, but didn't know what to expect the moment we arrived. The rooms were equally sophisticated and the comfort of everthing made our stay worthwhile. The night before leaving, one of the hotel staff members even helped us to find a nice club that we could go to hang out for a few hours. I would definately recommend this wonderful hotel to all of my family and friends. Not only was it modern and sophisticated, but it was clean! The only bad thing about our stay was that we didn't have many restaraunts around. You just have to get back on the expressway and drive a few exits (hotel staff helpful with this as well), which was no big deal. You could walk across the street to purchase snacks at the gas station/store.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: davidmg1
Reviews.Content: The hotel recently upgraded from AmeriSuites to the Hyatt Place. There was still some remodeling going on in the lobby, the rooms and hallways were finished. Got a great rate under $100. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The rooms are amazing. Very modern, with 42" HD TV with HD channels. The furniture is very comfortable, as so is the king size "Hyatt" bed in my room. The room was very clean and cool. I hadn't yet tried the free cold breakfast yet, but there is hot food to order. Hyatt has a hit here with the Hyatt Place. As a road warrior I really appreciate what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable on all fronts!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: Of all of the deals I have got on Priceline in the past few years, this has to rank as one of the best. I paid $34.00 last night for a five star room ($189 on their website) Everything in the June 25 review is true, EXCEPT there is no construction. The place is beautiful. I wanted to stay a month. Even at a higher price it would be well worth it. Not included in the previous reviews are a couple of things. First, the breakfast that is free includes cereal, toast, fruit, juice and coffee. If you want hot entrees, there is a menu and the charges are a reasonable $5.50. However, the set-up for the breakfast was top notch; neat, tidy, and first class. Also, the workout room is definitely a step up. Free weights, machines and nice cardio equipment was all evident. The hotel is 100% non-smoking and about three minutes from the airport. The staff is great as well. Jessica checked me in and couldn't have been nicer. She arranged to have the hotel shuttle (which is 24 hours by the way) pick me up at the Avis lot rather then at the airport. This place is a great example of finding a great place on Priceline, but I wouldn't hesitate to pay more in the future to stay there again. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Okay for Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: mrs_shopthe
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before flying to Cancun on 07-16-07. Our experience was just ok. We chose this hotel for the Hyatt name as well as the parking package. Our room was pre-paid and booked through a travel agent. We received a printed confirmation with arrival/departure info and confirmation number. When we arrived, there was no record of our reservation. After contacting our travel agent, we were able to get into a room. We reserved a room with two beds and a couch, but our room only had one bed and a couch. We made due. The hotel is currently being remodeled; changing from AmeriSuites to Hyatt Place. The hotel did their best to keep it contained, but there was very little parking available due to many dumpsters and machinery in the back lot. Our room was on the 4th floor. It was beautifully decorated, but quite dirty! The new carpeting was already filthy and there was mold in the toilet. The bathroom floor had not been swept as there was a lot of hair and dirt. (I am by far a neat-freak. It was pretty gross!) The bed was SO VERY COMFORTABLE! I did lay on the pullout sofa with our kids for a while and it was not that bad for a pull-out. All of the linens were new and clean. We did not use the pool because we wanted to be well rested for our trip. The HDTV was great a great alternative for the kids! There was NO FOOD available at the hotel which contradicted the info we received. They do have a few menus at the front desk of places that will deliver. (We did not have a phone book or area info book in our room). We were not able to gain access to the internet in our room -even though the front desk clerk said the whole hotel is wireless. The staff was friendly and helpful. The shuttle was prompt both ways. I think next time we will try the Adam's Mark across the street just to see how it compares. The prices were just about the same. We thought it would be nicer here- maybe after the remodeling? That was not even an issue for us. There was not a lot of noise after we checked in about 4:30pm. (The air conditioner in the room was pretty loud - and VERY cold!) Our biggest disappointment was the cleanliness of the room. Despite that, we still had a relaxing evening before our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Park and Fly Deal”
Reviews.Author: reed13ja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night previous to a trip out of Indy Airport. We booked a Park and Fly package, and were allowed to park our car at the hotel for free during the trip (up to 14 free days). In addition they have a 24-hr on demand shuttle to the airport. When we were ready to go we went down to the lobby, had free hot breakfast (which was very good) and then got right on the shuttle van and went to the airport. When we returned from our trip, we called them with a courtesy phone by the baggage claim and they came right away to pick us up. Regarding the room, it was clean and comfortable enough but it is certainly getting dated. Speaking of which, they are doing renovations at the hotel between the hours of 8AM and 7PM. The construction was over by the time we got there and hadnt started yet by the time we left, so I can't tell you how loud it is. If you are staying here for more than one night - the hotel is average. If you are staying here to use the Park and Fly package - the hotel is a great deal. We payed less to drive to the hotel, stay there for the night, and park there for our trip than we would have payed for airport parking. :)

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Indianapolis Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5500 Bradbury Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46241 (Formerly AmeriSuites)
